xyz.fsgek.common.io

Class GekIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.fsgek.common.io.GekIO

  • public class GekIO
extends java.lang.Object
    Input/Output utilities.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int IO_BUFFER_SIZE
      Default IO buffer size: 1024 * 8 = 8192.

      • read

        @Nullable
public static @Nullable byte[] read(java.io.InputStream source)
                                        throws GekIOException
        Reads all bytes from source stream into an array. Returns the array, or null if no data read out and reaches to the end of stream.
        Parameters:
        source - source stream
        Returns:
        the array, or null if no data read out and reaches to the end of stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • read

        @Nullable
public static @Nullable byte[] read(java.io.InputStream source,
                                               int number)
                                        throws GekIOException
        Reads specified number of bytes from source stream into an array. Returns the array, or null if no data read out and reaches to the end of stream.

        If the number < 0, read all as read(InputStream); els if the number is 0, no read and return an empty array; else this method will keep reading until the read number reaches to the specified number, or the reading reaches the end of the stream.

        Parameters:
        source - source stream
        number - specified number
        Returns:
        the array, or null if no data read out and reaches to the end of stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • readTo

        public static int readTo(java.io.InputStream source,
                         byte[] dest)
        Reads bytes from source stream into dest array, returns actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of stream. This method will keep reading until the dest array is filled up, or the reading reaches the end of the stream.
        Parameters:
        source - source stream
        dest - dest array
        Returns:
        actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • readTo

        public static int readTo(java.io.InputStream source,
                         byte[] dest,
                         int offset,
                         int length)
                  throws GekIOException
        Reads bytes of specified length from source stream into dest array starting from given offset, returns actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of stream. This method will keep reading until the read number reaches to the specified length, or the reading reaches the end of the stream.
        Parameters:
        source - source stream
        dest - dest array
        offset - given offset
        length - specified length
        Returns:
        actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

        public static int readTo(java.io.InputStream source,
                         java.nio.ByteBuffer dest)
        Reads bytes from source stream into dest buffer, returns actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of stream. This method will keep reading until the dest buffer is filled up, or the reading reaches the end of the stream.
        Parameters:
        source - source stream
        dest - dest buffer
        Returns:
        actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

        public static long readTo(java.io.InputStream source,
                          java.io.OutputStream dest)
                   throws GekIOException
        Reads all bytes from source stream into dest stream, returns actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of source stream. This method will keep reading until the reading reaches the end of source stream.
        Parameters:
        source - source stream
        dest - dest stream
        Returns:
        actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of source stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • readTo

        public static long readTo(java.io.InputStream source,
                          java.io.OutputStream dest,
                          long number)
                   throws GekIOException
        Reads specified number of bytes from source stream into dest stream, returns actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of source stream.

        If the number < 0, read all; els if the number is 0, no read and return 0; else this method will keep reading until the read number reaches to the specified number, or the reading reaches the end of the stream.

        Parameters:
        source - source stream
        dest - dest stream
        number - specified number
        Returns:
        actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of source stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • readTo

        public static long readTo(java.io.InputStream source,
                          java.io.OutputStream dest,
                          long number,
                          int bufferSize)
                   throws GekIOException
        Reads specified number of bytes from source stream into dest stream, returns actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of source stream.

        If the number < 0, read all; els if the number is 0, no read and return 0; else this method will keep reading until the read number reaches to the specified number, or the reading reaches the end of the stream.

        Parameters:
        source - source stream
        dest - dest stream
        number - specified number
        bufferSize - buffer size for each IO operation
        Returns:
        actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of source stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

        number - specified number

        the string, or null if no data read out and reaches to the end of reader

      • toInputStream

        public static java.io.InputStream toInputStream(java.io.Reader reader)
                                         throws GekIOException
        Wraps given reader as InputStream with GekChars.defaultCharset(). The returned stream doesn't support mark/reset methods.
        Parameters:
        reader - given reader
        Returns:
        given reader as InputStream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • toInputStream

        public static java.io.InputStream toInputStream(java.io.Reader reader,
                                                java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
                                         throws GekIOException
        Wraps given reader as InputStream with specified charset. The returned stream doesn't support mark/reset methods.
        Parameters:
        reader - given reader
        charset - specified charset
        Returns:
        given reader as InputStream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

                                                         int offset,

                                                  throws GekIOException
        Wraps given array as ByteArrayInputStream, starting from given offset with specified length.
        Parameters:
        array - given array
        offset - given offset
        length - specified length
        Returns:
        given array as ByteArrayInputStream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • read

        @Nullable
public static @Nullable byte[] read(java.nio.ByteBuffer source)
                                        throws GekIOException
        Reads all bytes from source buffer into an array. Returns the array, or null if no data read out and reaches to the end of buffer.
        Parameters:
        source - source buffer
        Returns:
        the array, or null if no data read out and reaches to the end of buffer
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • read

        @Nullable
public static @Nullable byte[] read(java.nio.ByteBuffer source,
                                               int number)
                                        throws GekIOException
        Reads specified number of bytes from source buffer into an array. Returns the array, or null if no data read out and reaches to the end of buffer.

        If the number < 0, read all as read(ByteBuffer); els if the number is 0, no read and return an empty array; else this method will keep reading until the read number reaches to the specified number, or the reading reaches the end of the buffer.

        Parameters:
        source - source buffer
        number - specified number
        Returns:
        the array, or null if no data read out and reaches to the end of buffer
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • readTo

        public static int readTo(java.nio.ByteBuffer source,
                         java.nio.ByteBuffer dest)
                  throws GekIOException
        Reads bytes from source buffer into dest buffer, returns actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of buffer. This method will keep reading until the dest buffer is filled up, or the reading reaches the end of the buffer.
        Parameters:
        source - source buffer
        dest - dest buffer
        Returns:
        actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of buffer
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • readTo

        public static int readTo(java.nio.ByteBuffer source,
                         java.nio.ByteBuffer dest,
                         int number)
                  throws GekIOException
        Reads specified number of bytes from source buffer into dest buffer, returns actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of buffer.

        If the number < 0, read as readTo(ByteBuffer, ByteBuffer); els if the number is 0, no read and return 0; else this method will keep reading until the read number reaches to the specified number, or the reading reaches the end of the buffer (of source or dest).

        Parameters:
        source - source buffer
        dest - dest buffer
        number - specified number
        Returns:
        actual read number, or -1 if no data read out and reaches to the end of buffer
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

        Returns:
        the slice buffer

                                            int number)
                                     throws GekIOException

        Parameters:
        buffer - given buffer
        number - specified number
        Returns:
        the slice buffer

      • subBuffer

        public static java.nio.ByteBuffer subBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                            int offset)
                                     throws GekIOException
        Returns a sub-range view of given buffer, starting from given offset to buffer's limit. The two buffers will share the same data so any operation will reflect each other.

        Note the offset is counted from 0, not buffer.position().

        Parameters:
        buffer - given buffer
        offset - given offset
        Returns:
        the sub-buffer
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • subBuffer

                                            int offset,
                                            int length)
                                     throws GekIOException
        Returns a sub-range view of given buffer, starting from given offset to specified length. The two buffers will share the same data so any operation will reflect each other.

        Note the offset is counted from 0, not buffer.position().

        Parameters:
        buffer - given buffer
        offset - given offset
        length - specified length
        Returns:
        the sub-buffer
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • split

        public static java.util.List<java.nio.ByteBuffer> split(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                                        int length)
        Splits given buffer in specified length, returns split buffer list. This method starts the loop:
        • If remaining length is >= specified length, this method will use ByteBuffer.slice() to generate a slice buffer of specified length. Then moves the position with specified length.
        • If remaining length is less than specified length, loop will be broken.
        Parameters:
        buffer - given buffer
        length - specified length
        Returns:
        split buffer list

      • split

        public static java.util.List<java.nio.ByteBuffer> split(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                                        int length,
                                                        java.util.function.IntFunction<java.nio.ByteBuffer> generator)
        Splits given buffer in specified length, returns split buffer list. This method starts the loop:
        • If remaining length is >= specified length, this method will call generator with specified length to generate new buffer. If generator return a new buffer, this method will fill data from given buffer into new buffer. If generator return null, use ByteBuffer.slice() to generate a slice buffer of specified buffer. Then moves the position with specified length.
        • If remaining length is less than specified length, loop will be broken.
        Parameters:
        buffer - given buffer
        length - specified length
        generator - given buffer generator, the argument is specified length
        Returns:
        split buffer list

      • split

        public static java.util.List<java.nio.ByteBuffer> split(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                                        int lengthOffset,
                                                        int lengthSize)
        Splits given buffer in specified length, returns split buffer list. This method assumes the length is specified at specified length offset, and starts the loop:
        • Marks current position. If remaining length is >= lengthOffset + lengthSize, this method will skip and read number of lengthSize bytes at lengthOffset as specified length.
        • Resets current position. If remaining length is >= specified length, this method will use ByteBuffer.slice() to generate a slice buffer of specified length. Then moves the position with specified length.
        • If remaining length is less than lengthOffset + lengthSize or specified length, loop will be broken.
        Parameters:
        buffer - given buffer
        lengthOffset - offset of length
        lengthSize - byte number of length, must in 1, 2, 4
        Returns:
        split buffer list

      • split

        public static java.util.List<java.nio.ByteBuffer> split(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                                        int lengthOffset,
                                                        int lengthSize,
                                                        java.util.function.IntFunction<java.nio.ByteBuffer> generator)
        Splits given buffer in specified length, returns split buffer list. This method assumes the length is specified at specified length offset, and starts the loop:
        • Marks current position. If remaining length is >= lengthOffset + lengthSize, this method will skip and read number of lengthSize bytes at lengthOffset as specified length.
        • Resets current position. If remaining length is >= specified length, this method will call generator with specified length to generate new buffer. If generator return a new buffer, this method will fill data from given buffer into new buffer. If generator return null, use ByteBuffer.slice() to generate a slice buffer of specified buffer. Then moves the position with specified length.
        • If remaining length is less than lengthOffset + lengthSize or specified length, loop will be broken.
        Parameters:
        buffer - given buffer
        lengthOffset - offset of length
        lengthSize - byte number of length, must in 1, 2, 4
        generator - given buffer generator, the argument is specified length
        Returns:
        split buffer list

      • split

        public static java.util.List<java.nio.ByteBuffer> split(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                                        byte delimiter)
        Splits given buffer in specified delimiter, returns split buffer list. This method starts the loop:
        • Marks current position, reads until meets specified delimiter.
        • If specified delimiter is met, this method will use ByteBuffer.slice() to generate a slice buffer of read data (delimiter exclusive). Then moves the position to next of delimiter.
        • If no specified delimiter is met, reset position and loop will be broken.
        For example: 
             split("123|456|789|") = ["123", "456", "789"]
     split("|123|456|789|") = ["", "123", "456", "789"]
     split("|123|456|78") = ["", "123", "456"] and reset to position 9
        Parameters:
        buffer - given buffer
        delimiter - specified delimiter
        Returns:
        split buffer list

      • split

        public static java.util.List<java.nio.ByteBuffer> split(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                                        byte delimiter,
                                                        java.util.function.IntFunction<java.nio.ByteBuffer> generator)
        Splits given buffer in specified delimiter, returns split buffer list. This method starts the loop:
        • Marks current position, reads until meets specified delimiter.
        • If specified delimiter is met, this method will call generator with length of read data to generate new buffer. If generator return a new buffer, this method will fill data from given buffer into new buffer. If generator return null, use ByteBuffer.slice() to generate a slice buffer of read data (delimiter exclusive). Then moves the position to next of delimiter.
        • If no specified delimiter is met, reset position and loop will be broken.
        For example: 
             split("123|456|789|") = ["123", "456", "789"]
     split("|123|456|789|") = ["", "123", "456", "789"]
     split("|123|456|78") = ["", "123", "456"] and reset to position 9
        Parameters:
        buffer - given buffer
        delimiter - specified delimiter
        generator - given buffer generator, the argument is specified length
        Returns:
        split buffer list

      • isSimpleWrapper

        public static boolean isSimpleWrapper(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Returns whether given buffer is a simple wrapper of back array: 
             return buffer.hasArray()
             && buffer.position() == 0
             && buffer.arrayOffset() == 0
             && buffer.limit() == buffer.array().length;
        Parameters:
        buffer - given buffer
        Returns:
        whether given buffer is a simple wrapper of back array

      • readBack

        public static byte[] readBack(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Returns back array if isSimpleWrapper(ByteBuffer) returns true for given buffer, and the position will be set to buffer.limit(). Otherwise, return read(ByteBuffer).
        Parameters:
        buffer - given buffer
        Returns:
        back array if isSimpleWrapper(ByteBuffer) returns true for given buffer

        public static java.io.InputStream toInputStream(java.io.RandomAccessFile random)

        Note this method will seek position of random access file to given offset immediately.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        wrapped stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • toInputStream

        public static java.io.InputStream toInputStream(java.io.RandomAccessFile random,
                                                long offset,
                                                long length)
                                         throws GekIOException
        Wraps given random access file as an input stream, readable bytes from offset position to (offset + length), supports mark/reset. length can be set to -1 if to read to end of the file.

        Note this method will seek position of random access file to given offset immediately.

        Parameters:
        random - given random access file
        offset - offset position to start read
        length - length of readable bytes, or -1 to read to end of file
        Returns:
        wrapped stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • toOutputStream

        public static java.io.OutputStream toOutputStream(java.io.RandomAccessFile random)
                                           throws GekIOException
        Wraps given random access file as an output stream. The stream will lock the file with exclusive lock by FileChannel.tryLock(long, long, boolean).

        Note this method will seek position of random access file to given offset immediately.

        Parameters:
        random - given random access file
        Returns:
        wrapped stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception

      • toOutputStream

        public static java.io.OutputStream toOutputStream(java.io.RandomAccessFile random,
                                                  long offset,
                                                  long length)
                                           throws GekIOException
        Wraps given random access file as an output stream, written bytes from offset position to (offset + length). length can be set to -1 if to write unlimitedly. The stream will lock the file with exclusive lock by FileChannel.tryLock(long, long, boolean).

        Note this method will seek position of random access file to given offset immediately.

        Parameters:
        random - given random access file
        offset - offset position to start write
        length - length of written bytes, or -1 to write unlimitedly
        Returns:
        wrapped stream
        Throws:
        GekIOException - IO exception
